references.reason: This paper introduces the Nash bargaining solution, a core concept in game theory that underpins the fairness-aware meta-learning approach in this paper.
This foundational work in game theory provides the theoretical underpinning for the Nash bargaining solution used in the paper's methodology.

references.paper_title: Learning to reweight examples for robust deep learning
references.reason: This paper introduces the meta-learning framework for fairness that the current paper extends and improves upon.

references.paper_title: Forml: Learning to reweight data for fairness
references.reason: This paper proposes a one-stage fairness-aware meta-learning method that the current paper uses as a baseline and improves upon with a two-stage approach.

references.paper_title: Fairness without demographic data: A survey of approaches
references.reason: This survey paper provides a comprehensive overview of fairness-aware machine learning methods without relying on demographic data, which is relevant to the current paper's focus on group-level fairness.
